snippet: The killing of a man by an Afghan migrant has left residents of a small town in the German heartland concerned about their community’s future.
abstract: Celle Journal; residents of Celle, Germany, were shocked to learn that Mehdi Hushmand, longtime Iranian emigre and beloved local schoolteacher, had been murdered by newly arrived Afghanistan migrant he had taken under his wing; issue also taps into country's larger conflicted feelings about migration.

byline.contributor: Katarina Johannsen contributed reporting from Celle. Victor Homola contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The killing of a man by an Afghan migrant has left residents of a small town in the German heartland concerned about their community’s future.

headline.main: A Murder Taps Into Germany’s Conflicted Relations With Migrants
headline.print_headline: A Murder Taps Into Germany’s Conflicted Relations With Migrants

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
